lines.text: Has Dave said any more about enlistin'?
No, but I look for him to the first time he gets to town.
Yeah, and I reckon you won't be far behind him.
You aren't a-kiddin'. You know how I felt ever since the Maine was sunk.
[while heading for their long-overdue vacation, the Range Busters pursue and capture a murderous outlaw]
First it's bank robbers and now it's bushwhackers. Ain't we ever gonna finish our vacation?
Sam, tell me, who's the cook around here?
Me.
Well, who's the foreman?
Me.
In other words, you do just about everything.
Yes sir, I'm just a jack-in-the-box.
No, you mean a jack-of-all-trades.
No sir, I mean a jack-in-the-box. I'm always poppin' up on one job and sittin' down on another!
You know, it's mighty funny. I thought Uncle Abe had a lot of money. I thought there'd be more help around here.
Sam said he always had 12 to 15 hands. After he died, the men here left one by one.
They did?
Sam says they were scared off by ghosts. I don't believe it in, but according to Sam, some queer things have been going on here.
Like what?
Oh, strange sounds at night, the organ playing with no one around, flickering lights near the barn.
Sounds like barflies.
[Sam is preparing lunch]
Aren't you going to stay to eat?
If you live through it, I'll take a chance on supper.
[Elmer, Alibi's ventriloquist dummy, is reading minds]
Quiet! I got to concentrate here. You're thinkin' about somebody that's dead. Somebody named R... O... Roberts!
So what? Reno Red and Roberts are all the same guy.
Is that right? Do you know somebody named Roberts?
I used to. Go ahead... Tell me what I'm thinkin' about.
I can't get it clear. No, I lost it... No, I get it. You're thinking about his money!
That dummy's too smart!
[referring to Alibi]
Say, he's looking for a job.
Well, if you're interested, be sure and come out. I'll have a good job for you.
How about me?
Are you a cowhand?
Oh, I've been a roper and a rider, a bulldogger and a fighter, a bronco buster and a dynamiter. Yippee!
I'm sorry. You haven't had enough experience.
[referring to 'Alibi' and Elmer]
Kind of a big man to be playin' with dolls.
[last lines]
Hey, fellas, they're stealin' your horses!
[Alibi, Rex and Sam rush out of the house]
Oh, pardon me, Helen, you know, that was just a gag. I don't like to say goodbye with so many people around... you know what I mean?
[bends over to kiss her]
Hey, you know they're stealin' your horse, too, Dusty!
